channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Volunteer to Help CCPD at the Unity House of Troy Thanksgiving Food Drive!
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 23, 2024 7:30 AM - 12:00 PM - Register to join the CCPD as they help at the Unity House of Troy’s annual Thanksgiving food drive, an impactful event that aims to provide essential food items for local families in need.
item.author: Students

item.title: SHC Offering Free Flu Shot Clinic for Students November 19
item.description: The Student Health Center will be holding a final flu shot clinic to students on Tuesday, November 19 from 10:30 AM to 5:00 PM in the DCC hallway. No appointment necessary; just stop by with your student ID!
item.author: Students

item.title: Second Economics Virtual Info Session to Be Held November 20
item.description: Join us for an online info session on our PhD in Applied Econ and Policy and MS in Econ programs on Wed, Nov 20th, at 10:00 AM. Learn about the program structures and focus areas, ideal applicants for each program, and funding opportunities. Registration is required to receive the Zoom link.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Coffee & Art” Sessions Continue November 19
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. Stop by to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Lift & Learn” Fitness/Nutrition Sessions Continue November 20
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - In this fitness and nutrition program, led by our experienced strength and conditioning coach, participants will engage in guided workout sessions tailored to various fitness levels and learn about proper nutrition to support their fitness goals. Please register if you would like to attend!
item.author: Students

item.title: Event to Introduce Partnership between RPI and Albany Medical College Bioinformatics Core
item.description: Join us and Ramon Bossardi Ramos, PhD., Director of the Bioinformatics Core at Albany Medical College, at 2:00PM on Monday, November 18 in CBIS Bruggeman as Dr. Ramos introduces AMC’s newest research core and how it can enhance research across many disciplines at RPI. AMC and RPI are exploring a partnership that would allow researchers at either institution to use the RPI Genomics Core and the AMC Bioinformatics Core with internal rates.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Raven Chacon: A Talk on New and Recent Work” Slated for November 21
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 21, 2024 6:00 PM - All are invited to join award-winning composer and visual artist Raven Chacon for a free talk on his recent work, which explores the sonic, visual, and thematic elements of his experimental practice. Chacon will also introduce a new EMPAC-commissioned project with San Francisco-based experimental music duo The Living Earth Show, which is being developed over the next year and includes artists and musicians based in New York’s Hudson Valley and Capital Region.
item.author: Community

item.title: Collegiate Store Announces 20% Off Early Black Friday Sale
item.description: From Monday, November 18 until Friday, November 22, the Rensselaer Collegiate Store will have an early Black Friday sale featuring 20% off select brands including League, Legacy and Fall Rush! Sale applies to items that are available in-store on the lower level of the Rensselaer Student Union or online.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Building a Global Cyber Community” Topic of November 20 ISC2 Chapter Meeting
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory will host a cyber workshop with Holly Schneider Brown, Senior Director of ISC2’s Center for Cyber Safety and Education. The workshop, which is open to the RPI community, will focus on building a global cyber community.
item.author: Community

item.title: Department of Chemistry Seminar Scheduled for November 19
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 4:15 PM - 5:15 PM - The Department of Chemistry seminar series continues with the Charles Reed Lecture in Chemistry featuring Angela K. Wilson, Professor of Chemistry at Michigan State University, who will speak about “Unraveling the Periodic Table, Spanning Thermochemistry and Spectroscopy to Environmental Contaminants.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Van Sandt, Brucker to Lead EMPAC Tour
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 23, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:30 AM - Join Director for Stage Technologies Stephanie Van Sandt and Lead Video Engineer Eric Brucker in this behind-the-scenes tour highlighting all the nuts and bolts that make EMPAC’s spaces work, and learn about how technology and creativity meld in collaboration with artists in the creation of new work. No reservations are necessary for this public tour, which is free to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: November 19 Session to Review Certificates in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for a session highlighting Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI. Attendees can expect to learn how data can inform better decisions, and will review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please register to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Dr. Daniel Vignon of NYU to Speak at CEE Seminar
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a talk titled “Safety, Liability, and Insurance Markets in the Age of Automated Driving,” Dr. Daniel Vignon, Asst. Professor from New York University. investigates two fundamental questions related to safety and insurance in the age of automation.
item.author: Community

item.title: United Way Holiday Wreath, Poinsettia Sale Open Through November 26
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 7, 2024 11:00 AM - Tue , November 26, 2024 11:00 AM - The annual United Way Holiday Wreath and Poinsettia pre-order sale is now open through Tuesday, November 26! You must submit your order form with payment by Tuesday, November 26; pickup will be during the Armory’s community fair/supplier showcase between the hours of 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. on Thursday, December 5.

item.title: HelioCampus Training to Assist Faculty with Adding Questions to End-of-Term Evaluations
item.description:
Rensselaer’s end-of-term course evaluations for the Fall 2024 semester will open to students on November 25 and close on December 11, with reports available to instructors on January 3, 2025. Any instructors who wish to add questions to their courses prior to the course survey opening may do so until November 24; the Office of Undergraduate Education will be offering webinar training sessions on November 12 and 20 to those who need assistance adding their questions.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
